item.title: Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 Exact Release Date & Start Times
item.content:encoded:
New content continues to come thick and fast in Marvel Rivals, with the release date for Season 6.5 now rapidly approaching.

The launch of Season 6 made waves with the long-awaited addition of Deadpool, but NetEase is not resting on their laurels and have plenty more up their sleeves in future drops.

For all the details on the Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 release date, start times, and what to expect, Insider Gaming has you covered.

When Does Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 Release?

Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 kicks off on February 13, but the mid-season transition means you won’t need to rapidly grind through the Battle Pass.

As is customary in the mid-seasdon update, the Season 6 Battle Pass will continue, but there will be new additions in Season 6.5, including new cosmetics and likely limited-time passes.

The slew of new content won’t be as big as was seen at the start of Season 6, however, with the next big drop instead coming at the start of Season 7 in May.

Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 Start Times

The start time for Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 has not been confirmed, but previous updates suggest the season will kick off at 2 AM PT on February 13.

That means a later start in morning for those elsewhere in the United States, though it will still be in the early hours, while those in Europe have to wait until mid-morning, and those down under must wait until th evening.

The table below shows the expected Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 start times in major regions across the world.

All Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 Content

After Deadpool’s arrival at the start of Season 6, Season 6.5 is headlined by the arrival of Elsa Bloodstone as the latest playable character.

New maps and new cosmetics are also set to be introduced, and there will likely be a Valentine’s Day collab introduced at the start of the season.

Marvel Rivals could also issue further hints towards additions coming in the Season 7 launch in March, adding to the speculation after a gallery card featured teases for Black Cat and White Fox.

What do you want to see added to Marvel Rivals in Season 6.5? Share your ideas in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Marvel Rivals, read how Deadpool’s addition led to a huge boom in player numbers, and check out the verdict on whether the Season 6 Battle Pass is worth buying.

item.title: Nioh 3 Release Date Countdown & Exact Start Times
item.content:encoded:
Soulslike fans are in for another rough and rewarding ride with Nioh 3. Team Ninja brings back its acclaimed Souls series, and this guide quickly tells you the Nioh 3 release date and what time it’s dropping.

It’s easy to see why Nioh 3 is one of the biggest upcoming Soulslike games in 2026. The team behind it is an expert in making eye-catching worlds, overcome by beauty and big Yokai beasts that will cut you down in your prime. Team Ninja‘s Nioh 3 could go down as the best Soulslike this year.

When Is Nioh 3 Coming Out?

Nioh 3 is all set for a February 6 release date across multiple platforms around the world.

While there have been questions about possible Nioh 3 early access and a demo, there’s no doubt about the game’s release date. Nioh 3 drops at the end of the first week in February, getting the month off to a feisty start!

  • More IG: Nioh 3 has a timed console exclusivity deal with Playstation

February is normally when the gaming year heats up. After a quiet December and January, publishers start launching new games, and Nioh 3 is one of the biggest AAA releases in 2026 to this point.

Nioh 3 Release Times

Nioh 3 is expected to have a midnight launch across all regions, meaning you can start playing from 6 PM PT on February 5, with adjusted times for other regions.

If you want a quick date and time reference so you know when you can start playing Nioh 3, the table below has many of the main areas covered.

Check out when you can start playing Nioh 3.

As usual, Australasia gets the short end of the stick, but Nioh 3 is sure to be worth the wait. You’ll have an answer to this soon with the end of the Nioh 3 review embargo!

If you played the demo or any Nioh game in general, share your thoughts about the franchise via the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Also, if you didn’t know, any Nioh 3 demo progress you make will carry over to the full game.

item.title: Fortnite Festival Season 13: Release Date, Start Times & Headline Act
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite continues to roll out new content, and the latest major drop is set to be the start of Fortnite Festival Season 13, bringing a new headline act onto the stage.

The current season, headlined by LISA, is on the cusp of ending, and Insider Gaming has all the details on her successor, along with the Fortnite Festival Season 13 release date and start times.

What is The Fortnite Festival Season 13 Release Date?

Fortnite Festival Season 13 is set to kick off on Thursday, February 5, landing alongside the next major update in Chapter 7, Season 1.

Downtime will take place ahead of the launch of the new Fortnite Festival season, where Epic Games will also be adding new collabs and cosmetics in the Item Shop, along with potential additions to the main Battle Royale mode.

The launch of Season 13 will introduce a new Festival Pass, offering both free and premium rewards.

What is Fortnite Festival Season 13’s Start Time?

An official start time for Fortnite Festival Season 13 has not been announced, though we do know it will be available when servers are back up after the February 5 patch.

Downtime for Fortnite usually begins at 1 AM PT/4 AM ET and lasts between two and three hours. However, in some situations, downtime can be longer, particularly for larger updates or if an issue is discovered.

Expect Season 13 to be accessible around 4 AM PT/7 AM ET, and keep an eye on social media for news on when the game is back up.

Who is The Fortnite Festival Season 13 Headline Act?

Epic Games has not officially announced the Fortnite Festival Season 13 headline act, though it’s widely understood to be Chappel Roan.

Hints uncovered earlier this month include a Pink Pony Club makeover to Fortnite’s iconic llama, along with a new microphone and drumset found by dataminers, all of which could be included as cosmetics in the Festival Pass.

Chappel Roan already has plenty of big hits in Fortnite as Jam Tracks, including the likes of Hot to Go and Good Luck, Babe!

What headline acts do you want to see Fortnite Festival add in the future? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, read about the tease of the Honkai Star Rail collab, and see what Fortnite’s director had to say about plans to ‘spice up’ the current season.
